subject: Re: "plain" formatter broken in Ant w/ JUnit 4.x?
msgSnippet: Jason, I have only seen this behaviour when combining JUnit 4.x and Ant 1.6.x. Ant 1.7 shows the testnames when used with JUnit 4.x: Testcase: pdfExists took
messageBody:
Jason,

I have only seen this behaviour when combining JUnit 4.x and Ant
1.6.x.

Ant 1.7 shows the testnames when used with JUnit 4.x:

Testcase: pdfExists took 0,015 sec
Testcase: pdfIsFile took 0 sec
Testcase: pdfIsNotEmpty took 0 sec

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:
>
> Apologies if this has been discussed before, but I found nothing in
the
> FAQ or in the archives since 4.x's release on this specific topic.
I
> just switched from JUnit 3.8.1 to 4.1, and now the JUnit Ant task
> doesn't print the test
names when I use formatter="plain" instead of
> formatter="brief". Instead, it always prints "unknown," like so:
>
> [junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.02 sec
>
> All tests implement suite() by returning JUnit4TestAdapter, which I
> suspect is the culprit.
>
